translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders

analyzed: mahāvibhaṅga  sekhiya kaṇḍa  sak kacca vagga
translated: The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules for bhikkhunis
The sub-chapter on respectfully🔽The training rule on looking at the bowl with the intention to offend

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū ujjhānasaññī paresaṁ pattaṁ olokenti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū ujjhāna saññī paresam pattam olokenti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six looked at the bowls of others with the intention to offend. …

original: “Na ujjhānasaññī paresaṁ pattaṁ olokessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: na ujjhāna saññī paresam pattam olokessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not look at the bowls of others with the intention to offend,’ this is how you should train.”

analyzed: na ujjhāna saññinā paresam pattaḥ oloketabbo
translated: One should not look at the bowls of others with the intention to offend.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca ujjhānasaññī paresaṁ pattaṁ oloketi, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca ujjhāna saññī paresam pattam oloketi āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, looks at the bowls of others with the intention to offend, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if it is unintentional,🔽if he is not thinking,

analyzed: dassāmi iti vā dāpessāmi iti vā oloketi  na ujjhāna saññissa
translated: if he looks thinking, “I will give,” or “I will have it given,”
if he does not have the intention to offend,🔽if there is a reason;
if he is the first offender.🔽The eighth training rule is finished.
